page.title: 18Art and Craft, St.Peter
page.content: There are many sections to the Craft Centre. In most cases the items for sale are actually made on the premises. In one section customers may choose a pearl or pearls and have a piece of jewellery made. Elsewhere leather goods are made; belts with their own embossing being popular with the children. Jewellery from wire and enamelled copper is made in the third section. A lady makes stained glass ware in the shape of butterflies and various insects or stained glass pictures. She has pieces of coloured glass which she puts together with strips of copper soldering the edges to hold them together. Four people are engaged in glass blowing, making a variety of animal shapes, glasses and vases. All the items made in the various sections are for sale.
